observations: There are two main groups of color blocks in the input grids.
The color blocks in the output grids are shifted.
The output grid has the same dimensions as the input grid.
Some color blocks are preserved between the input and output.
Color blocks are converted to another color based on their position relative to each other.
The shapes of the color blocks are preserved.
hypotheses: Each connected component of a single color has its color changed based on a look-up table indexed by the input color and its position.
Each connected component of a single color is shifted in a certain direction, with color changes based on destination position and original color.
Each connected component is assigned a new color based on its size and original color.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: Each connected component is assigned a new color based on its size and original color.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: The shapes are preserved implying a shifting mechanism is more plausible than size dependent coloring.

selected_rule: Each connected component of a single color is shifted in a certain direction, with color changes based on destination position and original color.
step_plan: Identify connected components of a single color in the input grid.
Shift each connected component to a new location.
Change the colors of the shifted components based on a look-up table.
Place the shifted components into the output grid.
